lang.ja: リゾネーター・ギター

name: reyong
description: Set of 4 to 12 small metal gongs suspended in a string carriage, played by two to four players.

name: riq
description: The riq is a type of tambourine used as a traditional instrument in Arabic music.

name: rondador
description: The rondador is a set of chorded bamboo panpipes from Ecuador.

name: rototom
description: The rototom is a drum which has no shell and is tuned by rotating.

name: ruan
description: Ruan is a family of Chinese plucked lutes.

name: rubab
description: Related to bowed instrument rebab, it is played in many countries, from India to Afghanistan. It's made of wood and covered with a membrane and has 3 melody strings, 3 drone strings and 11/12 resonance strings.

name: rudra veena
description: Considered the originator of all Indian strings (veena) it was used for ritual and meditation, North Indian raga and Dhrupad music. It has two dried gourd resonators and a body of bamboo with 24 wooden frets and 4 main, 2-3 secondary and one drone string.

name: ryuteki
description: The ryuteki is a Japanese transverse flute used in gagaku.

name: rōria
description: thin quiet mouth harp like instrument made of wood or bone.

name: sabar
description: The sabar is a drum from Senegal which is normally played with one hand and one stick. The body is an elongated cylinder with tapered ends. The head is made of goatskin and is attached to the body using pegs.

name: saduk
description: A cross between a saxophone and a duduk invented and played by Alexander Berne

name: saluang
description:
Used traditionally by the Minang people of West Sumatra for love songs, in shamanic rites and for capturing tigers, this open end-blown bamboo flute can be decorated to resemble tiger-stripes. Played with a circular breathing technique, it is 75 cm long with 3 to 6 holes depending on subtype.
  • saluang darek "inland" 4 holes
  • saluang pauh/padang 6 holes
  • saluang sungai pagu 3 holes

name: samba whistle
description: The samba whistle is a tri-tone whistle used in samba music and other Brazilian music styles.

name: samica
description: also known as dangubica or kuterevka, it is similar to the bisernica and the ancestor of the entire tamburica ensemble. this plucked long-necked lute has two double strings and is played solo.

name: sanshin
description: The sanshin is an Okinawan string instrument which consists of a snakeskin-covered body, neck and three strings. It is traditionally played with a plectrum made of horn worn on the index finger.

name: santoor
description: Ancient hammered dulcimer with trapezoid walnut or maple soundbox, 25 bridges each with 4 strings that are hit by special mallets called mezrab. Used in traditional, folk and mystic Sufi music.

name: santur
description: Santur, Middle Eastern

name: sanxian
description: The sanxian is a Chinese lute with three strings.

name: sarangi
description: The sarangi is a short-necked, bowed string instrument from India, Nepal and Pakistan.

name: saron barung
description: Often called simply "saron", it plays the basic, balungan melody

name: saron demung
description: Called simply "demung", it is the largest and deepest pitched of the regular saron.

name: saron family
description:
Part of the Sundanese gamelan, these consist of a decorated wood resonator (rancak) upon which is resting six to nine thick, smooth, bronze or iron keys that are hit with mallets of hard wood or buffalo horn.

The saron family consists of the smallest member; saron panerus, the middle pitch member; saron barung and the largest member; sarong demung. Additionally, the largely obsolete slentho (which has been subsumed by the slenthem) is even deeper than the demung and the saron peking, which is a special slendro variant is even higher than the panerus, of which it shares an overlapping range. Finally the saron wayang is used in wayang performances.

name: saron panerus
description: Called simply "panerus", it has seven bronze keys resting on a decorated rancak box. Keys are hit by tabuh mallet with head of buffalo horn.

name: saron peking
description: Similar to panerus with which it has a different but overlapping range, it has 6 bronze keys tuned for the slendro key.

name: saron wayang
description: Used in the Javanese Wayang puppet theatre, it has nine large bronze keys set in a decorated frame.

name: sarrusophone
description: The sarrusophone is a family of transposing musical instruments, intended to serve as a replacement in wind bands for the oboe and bassoon.

name: sasando
description: Made of palmyra leaves that act as a resonator and a bamboo-tube stuck with wooden pegs where the plucked strings are attached, this traditional Indonesian instrument has an important place in folk history. It is still being used and modernised.

name: satsuma biwa
description: The satsuma biwa is a biwa with four strings and frets popularised during the Edo period.

name: saw duang
description: The saw duang is a two-stringed instrument used in traditional Thai music which has a cylindrical soundbox made of wood and a snakeskin resonator.

name: saw sam sai
description: The saw sam sai is a three-stringed bowed instrument from Thailand.

name: saw u
description: The saw u is a Thai bowed string instrument which has a soundbox made from a coconut shell with a cowskin resonator.

name: saxophone quartet
description: ensemble of four saxophones, generally SATBar

lang.ja: サクソフォーン四重奏

name: saz
description: The saz is a long-necked fretted lute

name: segunda
description: Bass member of the garifuna drum group.

name: seni rebab
description: Developed in India during medieval times by Tansen, making it larger, with a longer neck and giving it metal sympathetic strings.

name: setar
description: Derived from the Indian tritantri veena by the Persian poet Amir Khusro sometime in 13th century, it had 3 (now 4) strings and a long neck. It later gave name to the Indian sitar.

name: shaken idiophone
description: Shaken idiophone or rattle. Sound is produced by holding or containing usually small concussing parts.

name: shakers
description: Tube made of metal or bamboo, it is filled with seeds, pebbles or sand. Especially used in Latin American music, it is shaken rhythmically to produce sound.

name: shakuhachi
description: The shakuhachi is a Japanese end-blown flute.

name: shamisen
description: The shamisen, samisen or sangen is a three-stringed instrument from Japan which is played with a large triangular-shaped plectrum called a bachi. The body traditionally uses cat or dog skin, unlike the Chinese sanxian and Okinawan sanshin.

name: shawm
description: Shawm, Medieval and Renaissance instrument, predecessor to the oboe

name: shehnai
description: From the Indian subcontinent, it is used at marriages, in temples and concerts - made of wood with a double reed and wood/metal flared bell, it has 6-9 holes.

name: shekere
description: The shekere is a shaker from West Africa consisting of a gourd with beads woven into a net which covers the gourd.

name: sheng
description: The sheng is a Chinese free reed instrument consisting of a number of vertical pipes.

name: shichepshin
description: The shichepshin is a traditional bowed string instrument of the Circassian peoples.

name: shime-daiko
description: The shime-daiko is a small Japanese drum with a short but wide body which has a higher pitch than a normal taiko.

name: shinobue
description: The shinobue is a high-pitched transverse bamboo flute from Japan.

name: sho
description: The shō is a Japanese free reed instrument modelled on the Chinese sheng, although the shō tends to be smaller in size.

name: shruti box
description: The shruti box is similar to a harmonium and is used to provide a drone accompaniment.

name: shudraga
description: The shudraga is a Mongolian fretless lute with three strings.

name: siku
description: The siku is a traditional Andean panpipe.

name: sistrum
description: Used in sacred rituals, it is made of metal or clay rattle with metal discs which jangle when shook. </br> Not to be confused with the West African calabash sistrum or disc rattle (n'goso m'bara)

name: sitar
description: Soundbox made of gourd, it has 18-21 (6-7 on frets and 11-15 sympathetic under the frets) metal strings, two bridges and a long wooden neck where the tuning pegs of the sympathetic strings are attached. Used in India since ancient times, it flourished during the 16-17th before arriving at it's current form in the 18th century. It became popular worldwide in the 1950-60

name: slenthem
description: Used in Javanese gamelan, the 6(slendro)-7(pelog) bronze keys beat by a disk mallet(tabuh) are suspended above individual tube metal/bamboo resonators set in a 75 cm long wooden frame.

name: slentho
description: Unlike the other saron, its six-seven keys are not smooth, but bevelled or bossed, like the gendèr and the slenthem, which has largely replaced it in the modernised gamelan.

name: slide brass instruments
description: Slide brass instruments use a slide to change the length of tubing.

name: slide whistle
description: Slide whistle (infamous 'Clangers' sound)

name: slit drum
description: A slit drum is a hollow percussion instrument made of wood or bamboo with a slit at the top.

name: song loan
description: The song loan is a traditional Vietnamese instrument consisting of a hollow wooden body (about 7 cm in diameter) attached to a flexible spring with a wooden ball on the other end and played with the foot.

name: sopilka
description: Sopilka (generally) refers to a type of fife used in Ukrainian traditional music.

lang.ja: ソプラニーノ・リコーダー
ソプラニーノサクソフォーン
ソプラノ・クラリネット
ソプラニーノサクソフォーン

name: soprano violin
description: Tuned a fourth above and about three quarters the size of a standard violin.

lang.ja: ソプラノ・ヴァイオリン

name: spike-fiddle
description: Particular type of fiddle, long neck, often few strings and usually with a rather small soundbox, it has a spike at the end.

name: spilåpipa
description: The spilåpipa is a Swedish fipple flute with eight finger-holes on the top, but no thumb-holes. It has a modal tuning.

name: spinet
description: A smaller harpsichord, often with the strings at 30 degrees from the keyboard.

name: spinettone
description: Exceptionally long spinet, with multiple strings choirs, its bass-tones were produced by longer, not thicker strings.

name: steel-string guitar
description: The steel-string guitar is a modern form of acoustic guitar that is strung with steel strings.

name: string quartet
description: Chamber ensemble of four players (two violins, one viola, one cello)

name: string trio
description: Chamber ensemble of three players (one violin, one viola, one cello)

name: struck idiophone
description: Struck idiophone are ones where sound comes from striking the instrument and it as a whole vibrates, without the use of strings or membranes. Therefore these are most often made of sonorous material: metal, wood, glass and even stone.

lang.ja: サブ・コントラバス・リコーダー

name: suikinkutsu
description: A suikinkutsu is a type of Japanese garden ornament which uses dripping water to create music. Although it is also known as a Japanese water zither, it is named after the sound the koto (a Japanese zither) makes and is not actually a string instrument.

name: suka
description: The suka is a once-extinct fiddle from Poland.

name: suling
description: Made of bamboo, it has from 4 to 6 finger-holes and a small wedge-shaped fipple. There are many varieties all around Southeast Asia, it is also used in gamelan.

name: suona
description: Important to the folk music in northern China, it has a conical wooden body and seven finger holes.

name: surbahar
description: Effectively a bass sitar, it has 4 main, 3-4 chikari(drone) and 10-11 resonance strings strung over a wide wooden neck. Made of flat-cut gourd with a possible secondary resonator (tumba) it was invented in 1825 by sitar-player Ghulam Mohammed who wanted a deeper sound.

name: surdo
description: The surdo is a large bass drum used in Brazilian music, most notably samba.

name: sursingar
description: used in the Hindustani style Dhrupad music, it has steel and bronze strings and is played with a metal pick.

name: swarmandal
description: Used chiefly in classical Indian songstyles Khyal and Thumri, it has a trapezoid shape with up to 40 metal strings fastened at both sides by iron pegs with one side having tuning keys.

name: syrinx
description: Greek Panflute

name: sáo meò
description: saó ôi (flute of the Muong)

name: sáo trúc
description: The sáo trúc is a Vietnamese transverse flute made of bamboo.

name: sênh tiền
description: The sênh tiền is a Vietnamese instrument which is a combination of clappers, a rasp and a jingle, made from three pieces of wood with old Chinese coins attached.

name: t'rưng
description: The t'rưng is a bamboo xylophone from the central highlands of Vietnam which is played by ethnic groups such as the Bahnar and the Ê Đê.

name: tabla
description: The tabla is a pair of hand drums used in Hindustani classical music and in the traditional music of India, Pakistan, Afghanistan, Nepal, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka.

name: tabor
description: Side drum, often with one or more snares, worn by one person and beaten by one hand, it is often combined with tabor pipes.

name: tack piano
description: The tack piano is a permanently altered version of an ordinary piano, which has tacks or nails placed on the felt-padded hammers of the instrument at the point where the hammers hit the strings, giving the instrument a tinny, more percussive sound.

name: taepyeongso
description: The taepyeongso is a Korean double reed wind instrument which has a conical wooden body with a metal mouthpiece and cup-shaped metal bell.

name: taiko
description: Japanese traditional drum beaten with sticks called bachi.

lang.my: ဒိုင်ကိုဒရမ်

name: taishogoto
description: The taishōgoto is a Japanese string instrument with 2-12 strings and keys which are used to fret the strings.

name: talharpa
description: The talharpa is a four-stringed bowed lyre from northern Europe, mostly played in Estonia.

name: talkbox
description: A talkbox is an effects device which enables a musician to modify the sound of an instrument.

name: tamborim
description: The tamborim is a small frame drum from Brazil.

name: tambura
description: do not confuse with: Serb-Croat "tamburica" ensemble. Persian/Turkish ancient things evolved/came from "tanbur". unrelated Indian drone "tanpura" related Indian "pandour"

name: tanbou ka
description: Tanbou ka or Tambu ka (a small high-pitched drum)

name: tanbur
description: the ancient ancestor of many related lute like instruments.

name: tanpura
description: Usually accompanying sitar on ragas, the fretless instrument comes in different sizes: largest; male-voice, smaller; female-voice and smallest; the instrument-accompanying "tanpuri"

name: taonga pūoro
description: Traditional musical instruments of the Māori people of New Zealand. Consists of gourds (hue), shell flutes (pu), wooden flutes (koauau), wind roarers and other natural materials.

name: tap dance
description: Tap dancing is a type of dance in which the dancer wears special shoes that make a clicking sound as the dancer's feet strike the floor.

name: taphon
description: The taphon is a traditional barrel drum from Thailand.

name: tar
description: A tar is a single-headed frame drum from North Africa and the Middle East.

name: tar
description: The tar is a long-necked, waisted lute found in Azerbaijan, Iran, Armenia, Georgia, and other areas near the Caucasus region. Not to be confused with the drum of the same name.

name: taragot
description: The taragot is a Turkish/Hungarian/Romanian reed instrument related to the saxophone and clarinet.

name: tarota
description: Traditional Catalan double reed of medieval origin. Used for cobla music in the 19th century, it mostly disappeared: current tarotas are a modern re-invention.

name: te kū
description: also just "kū", a mouthbow with a single string, struck with a light implement of bone or wood.

name: tef
description: A Turkish version of tambourine / daf, made from animal skin and played with the fingers.

name: telharmonium
description: considered the first electromechanical musical instrument, an early electronic organ.

name: temür khuur
description: used in folkmedisine and shamanistic rituals

name: tenor banjo
description: A tenor banjo is a four-string banjo with tenor tuning, usually C G D A.

name: tenor guitar
description: Slightly smaller, four-string version of the steel-string acoustic guitar or electric guitar

lang.ja: テナーサクソフォーン

name: tenor trombone
description: The tenor trombone is a trombone pitched in B♭.

name: tenor viol
description: Tenor member of the viol family

lang.ja: テノール ヴィオラ

name: tenor violin
description: Tuned an octave below the traditional violin and at about half the size of the cello, it has a range between the cello and the viola. It has a longer neck and thinner ribs than the cello.

name: tenora
description: Derived from the tenor shawm, it was independently developed in Catalonia by oboe player Andreu Turon in the 19th century. Made of ginjoler wood with a metal cone, it is used in the traditional Cobla and Sardana music.

name: thavil
description: The thavil is a barrel shaped drum from South India.

name: theatre organ
description: Theatre organ, such as the Wurlitzer

name: theorbo
description: Developed as an extended range bass-lute in Italy during the late sixteenth century, it has an extended neck with a second pegbox.

name: thon
description: The thon is a goblet drum with a ceramic or wooden body used in classical Thai and Cambodian music which forms one part of thon and rammana.

name: three-hole pipe
description: Ancient pipe originating in Europe, with analogies all over the world, it is often combined with tabor drums.

name: ti bwa
description: ti bwa, percussion instrument made of a piece of bamboo laid horizontally and beaten with sticks

name: tible
description: Catalan double-reed, created in the 19th Century by adding valves to the tarota. Used principally for cobla music.

name: timpani
description: Timpani (Kettle drum)

name: tinya
description: The tinya is a small drum used in the traditional music of the Andes.

name: tiêu
description: The tiêu is a Vietnamese end-blown flute related to the Chinese xiao.

name: tololoche
description: The tololoche is a traditional musical instrument from northern Mexico, similar but smaller than the European double bass.

name: tom-tom
description: A tom-tom (or just tom) is a cylindrical drum with no snare, commonly found in a standard drum set.

name: tonkori
description: The tonkori is a plucked string instrument played by the Ainu of northern Japan and Sakhalin.

name: topshuur
description: The topshuur is a two-stringed lute from Mongolia and Tuva.

name: traditional basque ensemble
description: instruments used in the traditional music of the Basque people

name: trautonium
description: Electric instrument from the 1930's with a resistor wire and moving metal plate.

name: treble viol
description: The treble, descant or soprano member of the viol family

lang.ja: ドゥシュ で ヴィオラ

name: treble violin
description: Tuned an octave above and about quarter the size of the traditional violin.

lang.ja: トレブル・ヴァイオリン

name: trikiti
description: Diatonic button accordion used in traditional Basque ensemble

name: tritantri veena
description:
Used in India during the medieval period, it had a stick-zither body with 3 strings
For the the long necked lute called "tritantri veena" in the 19 century, see "sitar"

name: tromba marina
description: A tromba marina is a triangular bowed string instrument used in medieval and Renaissance Europe that consists of a body and neck in the shape of a truncated cone resting on a triangular base.

name: trumpet family
description: Family of the brass instrument trumpet

name: tràm plè
description: a variant of the "Hmông flute". flute blowers lips enclose the blowing hole with the vibrating "free reed" inside

name: trắng jâu
description: trắng jâu bass form of trắng lu

name: trống bông
description: The trống bông is a wooden Vietnamese drum with a single drumhead which is played with both hands.

name: tubax
description: The tubax is a modified saxophone which is more compact due to the tubing being folded more times.

name: tube zither
description: zither with a hollow or vaulted body, it can have several resonators

name: tubon
description: electronic bass organ proto-keytar

name: tubular bells
description: Larger orchestral version of chimes, closed top hollow metal tubes are set in a stand with a damper operated by pedals, they are tuned at a definite pitch and played with mallets.

name: tubulum
description: Invented (or atleast made popular by) Blue Man Group, it is made of alternating length PVC pipes and hit with sticks or flaps. It is popular with street musicians.

name: tumbi
description: The tumbi is a high pitched, single string plucking instrument associated with folk music of Punjab.

name: tumutumu
description: Made of resonating stone, wood or bone with a striker of stone, bone or hardwood, this ancient instrument was used for rhythm during chanting.

name: tungso
description: Made of thick aged bamboo, this notched end-blown flute may have had a buzzing membrane.

name: turntable
description: Used in turntablism, vinyl records are not simply played on it, instead DJ's perform creating sound.

name: txalaparta
description: Traditionally consisting of two long wooden planks with corn-husks attached for vibration and hit with long, thick sticks called Makilak, today the planks are shorter and can be made of many other materials like stone, wood or metal and are hit with shorter, lighter sticks.

name: txistu
description: Fipple flute that became a symbol for the Basque folk revival.

name: typewriter
description: Besides being used for writing, it has also been used in percussion.

name: tōkere
description: Castanets of wood, bone, bivalve shells or even flax leaf.

name: udu
description: The udu is a Nigerian idiophone consisting of a water jug with an additional hole.

name: ugal
description: Even lower pitched than the pemade , it also has 10 bronze keys suspended over tuned bamboo resonators that the player hits with a small hammer, often in a theatrical manner. It is the leader of the pokok melody.

name: ukeke
description: The ukeke is a Hawaiian musical bow made of koa wood, 16 to 24 inches long and about 1½ inches wide with two or three strings fastened through and around either end, tuned to an A major triad.

name: ukulele
description: The ukulele is a small guitar-like instrument commonly associated with Hawaiian music. It generally has four nylon or gut strings.

name: unspecified drum
description:
"Drum" or "drums" is a common but generic credit can refer to multiple instruments. If you know which instrument this is, please select the specific instrument:
  • For the instrument commonly known as "drums", and often used in Western popular music, use drums (drum set).
  • For programmed or "drum-loops" use drum machine.
  • For specific drums not yet in MusicBrainz, use membranophone (or slit drum, if appropriate) and consider requesting the missing instrument.
If you can't find more information than the generic "drum" or "drums" credit, use this instrument.

name: valiha
description: The valiha is a bamboo tube zither from Madagascar

name: valved brass instruments
description: Valved brass instruments use a set of valves which introduce additional tubing into the instrument.

name: veena
description:
One of the two subfamilies of Indian chordophones, the South Indian gourd lute used in classical Carnatic music has a single gourd music-box (sometimes a secondary small resonator gourd) with an often hollow neck.
Commonly called just "veena" or "vina", the representative is Saraswati veena, and credits to just "veena" are usually that.

name: venu
description: The venu is a bamboo transverse flute used in the Carnatic music of South India.

name: vessel flute
description: A vessel flute is a type of flute with an enclosed rather than cylindrical body.

name: vibrandoneon
description: wood accordina with piano keys invented in Italy

name: vichitra veena
description: Played like a slide guitar, it has two large gourd resonators with a teak body that often ends in carved peacock heads. Fretless, it has 4 main, 5 chikari and 13 resonance strings, slide is a glass orb named batta.

lang.ja: ヴィチトラ・ヴィーナ

name: viol family
description: Please use Viola da Gamba with credit "viol" for generic / unspecified viol credits, and not this one. Developed in the 15th century from vihuelists starting to play with bows, viols have frets, flat backs, sloped shoulders, c-holes and are tuned in fourths.

name: viola caipira
description: Used in folk-music, It has ten steel strings in five courses.

name: viola d'amore
description: While it is fretless and played like the violins "a la braccia", it has a flat back, c-holes and sloping shoulders like a viol. From the baroque period, it has up to 14 strings.

name: viola da gamba
description: The Generic member of the viol family, use it for "Viol" credits, most viola da gamba credits are however the Bass Viol

lang.ja: ヴィオラ・ダ・ガンバ

name: violin family
description:
Developed in the 16th century, these violas da braccio are distinct from the violas da gamba family.
Modern members are:
  • Violin (little viola)
  • Viola
  • Violoncello (small big viola)
  • Double Bass (replacing the violone (big viola))
Past members include the violone (now a considered a viol) and bass viol (a forerunner to the violoncello). Occasionally Octobass is also included as a member.

name: violin octet
description: New Violin Family of eight proportionally-sized violins developed mainly by Carleen Hutchins, each based directly on the standard violin and its acoustic properties, thus their sound is at a more homogeneous pitch "near the two middle open strings."

lang.ja: ヴァイオリン・オクテット

name: violino piccolo
description: The violino piccolo is a stringed instrument of the baroque period. Most examples are similar to a child's size violin in size and are tuned a third or a fourth higher.

name: viololyra
description: Inspired by the violin in 1920, Hellenic luthiers combined parts of the old Cretan lyra with the violin.

name: violoncello piccolo
description: The violoncello piccolo is a Baroque string instrument which is between the viola and cello in size and typically has five strings.

name: violone
description: Violone, The largest/deepest member of the Viol family

name: virginal
description: The virginals is a smaller and simpler rectangular form of the harpsichord with only one string per note

lang.ja: ボーカルシンセサイザー

name: vuvuzela
description: plastic horn often used at football matches in South Africa

name: whip / slapstick
description: Consisting of two parts joined together by a hinge, it creates a whip-like sound when clacked together.

name: whistle
description: simple, often single-toned and round-bodied whistle often used for regulation (sport, traffic, ...).

name: wind chime
description:
It differs from other chimes by addition of pendulum(s), such to be worked by wind, the sonorous parts can be rods, bells or other shapes of metal, wood, glass or ceramic.
Often decorated, it is seen as a good luck charm.

name: wind synthesizer
description: wind synthesizer or wind controller, it is connected to a midi controller and is played like a wind instrument.

name: wot
description: The wot is a circular panpipe from Laos and the Isan region of northeastern Thailand.

name: xiao
description: Ancient Chinese vertical, end-blown flute made of bamboo

name: xiaoluo
description: The xiaoluo is a Chinese small flat gong whose pitch rises when struck with the side of a flat wooden stick.

name: xun
description: The xun is a vessel flute from China which has a blowing hole at the top.

name: xylorimba
description: Member of the xylophone family, it has 5 octaves.

name: yangqin
description: It is related to similar hammered dulcimers in India, middle east and Europe.

name: yatga
description: The yatga is a traditional Mongolian plucked zither, similar to the Chinese guzheng.

name: yaylı tanbur
description: The yaylı tanbur is a bowed lute from Turkey derived from the older plucked tanbur.

name: yehu
description: The yehu is a Chinese bowed string instrument in the huqin family, made from a coconut shell.

name: yonggo
description: Used in the traditional Korean music daechwita, it consists of a large two headed wooden barrel painted with dragon designs.

name: yoochin
description: Originally introduced to Mongolia from China, it has 13 double wire-strings and a black lacquered wooden soundboard. Traditionally it was only played by townspeople.

name: yu
description: From atleast 600 BC, it is made of wood to resemble a tiger with its spine made into notches. Notches are scraped to produce sound, it was used in ensemble with zhu.

name: yueqin
description: It has a short fretted neck originally with four silk but now usually nylon or steel strings, and large flat round body, earning it the nickname "moon lute"

name: zabumba
description: The zabumba is a bass drum from Brazil.

name: zarb
description: The zarb is a goblet drum from Persia.

name: zhaleika
description: The zhaleika is a single reed hornpipe from Russia.

name: zhonghu
description: The zhonghu is a Chinese bowed string instrument developed from the erhu and tuned a fourth or a fifth lower.

name: zhongruan
description: The zhongruan is a Chinese plucked lute, the tenor-ranged size in the ruan family.

name: zhuihu
description: Originating from Henan province, this fretless huqin has the accustomary two strings, but is made of wood.

name: zill
description: Known since ancient times in south-east Europe and Turkey, small bronze finger cymbals are used for dancing and other performances. These are similar to the jingles set in some frame drums.

name: çevgen
description: Originating in Central Asia, it gained symbolic value to the Turks who used it in Ottoman marching-bands. It is 2-2,5 m long, has a bronze crescent shape with bells and jangles attached.

name: ütőgardon
description: The ütőgardon is a folk musical instrument played primarily in Transylvania. It is similar in appearance to a cello, but played percussively like a drum. Instead of being played with a bow, its strings are plucked and beaten with a stick.

name: čelo
description: counterpoint member of the Serbo-Coatian tamburica orchestra, it is guitar like like the bugarija. it can either have two double strings and two single strings (čelović) or now four single strings are more common. (čelo/čelović/) the čelović is a different pitch than the čelo

name: đing buốt
description: Ede traditional flute, four finger holes, blowing reed

name: đing năm
description: The đing năm is a gourd mouth organ used by minority ethnic groups in the central highlands of Vietnam.

name: đàn bầu
description: The đàn bầu is a one-stringed Vietnamese zither.

name: đàn nguyệt
description: The đàn nguyệt or đàn kìm is a two-stringed Vietnamese lute with a long neck and a circular, flat body.

name: đàn nhị
description: The đàn nhị is a Vietnamese stringed instrument with a small, cylindrical body, covered at one end with snakeskin. The bow passes between the two strings and the instrument has no frets. This instrument is of Chinese descent but has relatives all over Asia.

name: đàn tam
description: The đàn tam is a three-stringed fretless lute from Vietnam.

name: đàn tam thập lục
description: Recently imported into Vietnamese instruments, this thirty-six stringed dulcimer has many counterparts in various countries, such as "santoor" in India and "cimbalon" in Europe.

name: đàn tranh
description: The đàn tranh is a a long Vietnamese zither with sixteen strings and high, movable bridges. The strings are plucked with plectrums, while the left hand is used for ornamenting the notes by pressing the strings.

name: đàn tứ
description: The đàn tứ or đàn đoản is a traditional Vietnamese moon-shaped lute with a short neck.

name: đàn tứ dây
description: A latter-day construction in the form of a four-stringed, square-bodied bass guitar

name: đàn tỳ bà
description: The đàn tỳ bà is a four-stringed Vietnamese lute with a pear-shaped body. Like the Chinese pipa from which is derived, it has greatly elevated frets at the neck.

name: ģīga
description: The ģīga is a two-stringed bowed zither found in Latvia.

name: ōtsuzumi
description: The ōtsuzumi is an hourglass-shaped Japanese drum, larger than the kotsuzumi.

name: šargija
description: The šargija is a long necked plucked lute used in the folk music of the Balkans.

name: żafżafa
description: The żafżafa or rabbaba is a Maltese friction drum consisting of a container (made of tin, pottery or wood) covered with animal skin with a long Arundo donax reed attached.

name: żaqq
description: The żaqq is a Maltese bagpipe made from the complete skin of an animal (typically a premature calf, goat or dog). The chanter consists of two side-by-side pipes and a bull's horn is normally attached to the end.

name: żummara
description: The żummara is a Maltese instrument similar to a kazoo. It is made out of a piece of bamboo reed covered on one end by greaseproof paper tied with string. A melody is then hummed into a hole in the reed producing a rough raspy sound. Not to be confused with the Egyptian/Iraqi zummara which is an instrument similar to a chalemeau.
